WorkItem.Description: When I press Optimize it says I need to select the following and lists a few things that I supposedly have not checked.  When I go back to the slot charts, it says I have them enabled to be optimized.  I have read everything about Optimizing and stuff, but maybe I am missing something.  How do I fix it?

Comments.Message: Well, that warning really does mean what it says. If you post your character file, we may be able to point out what you're missing.

I have the same with my Shoulder Enchant, Astrylian. About 40% of the times I try to optimize my Druid (she has Inscription) it says I don't have a shoulder enchant checked. I then go to the shoulder enchant list, see it's checked and then can optimize fine.
Not been able to figure out what causes it yet :(
I hope I posted my character file right and it helps.
This seems like that it might be related to the following issue: http://rawr.codeplex.com/WorkItem/View.aspx?WorkItemId=16007 (I'm not on my home machine, so not able to pull this file up.  =P )
I read the related issue, but it happens every time I try to optimize, not 1 out of 20 or anything.  I also turned off my professions (Leatherworking and Skinning) but that did not help either.

Cat new.xml: When I attempted to load your character file, I could not as you have a Ring slot filled with an item of id 100000, which doesn't exist. I manually edited the file to remove those references and the file then loaded alright. However, I was unable to reproduce your issue, it looks like it may have been fixed by some of the optimizer work Kavan has been doing.

Shockg.xml: This file loaded fine, but there were no profession related enchants selected, in fact, no enchants were marked as available to the optimizer... so I'm not sure what this file was supposed to prove. I changed the Wrist enchant to Fur Lining - AP and it ran as expected.
